page.title: 06MANSFIELD FIRESTATION
page.content: {MANSFIELD FIRESTATION}WAS BUILT IN 1939 ON ROSEMARY STREET, NEAR THE JUNCTION OF CHESTERFIELD ROAD.THE MAIN BUILDING HAS A TV.ROOM,QUIET ROOM,DORMITORY,GENERAL OFFICE,MISSION ROOM,JUNIOR OFFICERS DORMITORY,SENIOR OFFICERS ROOM,CLEANING ROOM,COMPRESSOR ROOM,BREATHING APPARATUS AND GAMES ROOM. THERE ARE TWO GARAGES .THE LARGE ONE AT THE FRONT HOLDS 4 FIRE APPLIANCES,A SMALLER GARAGE AT THE BACK HOLDS ONE APPLIANCE.THERE IS ALSO A TRAINING TOWER AT THE BACK OF THE BUILDING WHERE THE FIREMEN PRACTICE WITH THEIR APPARATUS.THERE ARE 44 FIREMEN, 1 STATION OFFICER AND 1 SUB-STATION OFFICER.THE MEN WORK SPLIT_SHIFTS, 2 DAYS AND NIGHTS ON AND 4 DAYS OFF. WHEN THE FIREMEN GO ON DUTY THEY HAVE TO CHECK ALL THEIR EQUIPMENT TO MAKE SURE IT WORKS.
